IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Memorial Hospital provides Healthcare Services to the residents and visitors of the Mount Washington Valley area of New Hampshire.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Memorial Hospital provides Healthcare Services to the residents and visitors of the Mount Washington Valley area of New Hampshire
IRS990.Description: Ambulatory & Primary Health Care: Memorial Hospital provided care for 38,248 Outpatients and 13,065 Emergency Room patients. Program service expenses and revenues are included with Inpatient Care

Activity2.Description: Ambulatory & Primary Health Care: Memorial Hopsital operates Physician practices that provide Primary Care as well as Womens Health, Orthopedics, and several other specialties. Program service expenses and revenues are included with Inpatient Care. (51,693 visits)

Activity3.Description: Inpatient Care: Provided care for 1,915 admissions during FY '09. (The cost for the Outpatient, Emergency Room, and Physician Practices are included.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Endowment Fund retains permanently restricted funds with income available for general purposes. Also, a portion of the earnings are to be used to assist patients with free care. The remainder of the fund is board restricted.

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.IncomeBasedCriteria: In conjunction with the FPL guidelines the Hospital uses a Net Worth criteria. For an individual to qualify for a 100% discount the Net Worth must be at or below $200,000.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CostingMethodUsed: Worksheet 2 Ratio of Patient Care Cost to Charges was used to calculate cost
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: No Footnote. Worksheet 2 was used to calculate cost.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: The filed 2010 Medicare Cost report was used to report Hospital costs and revenues
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.DebtCollectionPolicy: The policy include the following statement: With the exception of insurance coverage, collection activity shall not be initiated or pursued for any amounts approved under the Memorial Hospitals Healthcare Assistance Program
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: The members of the Memorial Deveopment Foundation and other local agencies, providers and businesses, came together to form the MWV Community Heathcare Collaborative to cooperatively search for solutions to local health needs. In January 2010 they began a Community Needs Assessment. The "Six-Step Community Health Assessment Process" developed by the Association of Community Health Improvement was recommended to build the core framework for the project.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: The Hospital uses several methods for communicating and educating patients regarding assistance with the bills. At our registration and credit and collections offices it is visible to all with handouts. Our webiste includes information regarding the Healthcare Assistance program. On all bills with a patient liability a note is recorded that informs the patient or guarantor of the availability of assistance. Also the State Hospital Association website has links to various programs at the state and local levels.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: The hospital serves the northern part of Carroll County in NH and the western portion of Oxford County in Maine. The Mount Washington Valley is a four-season destination resort area and serves the tourists the frequent the area.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The Hospital will reimburse for Travel for Companions if prior approval by the Chairman of the Board is granted. As part of the recruitment for a ne CEO a housing allowance was granted for a temporary period of time.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: New Hampshire Health & Education Facilities Authority

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: To Construct & Renovate Hospital Facilities and Payoff Existing Debt

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The sole member of The Memorial Hospital is The Memorial Development Foundation, a 501(c)(3) organization

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The sole member Memorial Development Foundation ratifies the appointments to the Board of Trustees of the Memorial Hospital

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The form 990 was provided to the Finance committee and the full Board of Trustees. It was reviewed by the Finance Committee on January 18, 2011, and then forwarded to the full Board of Trustees on January 19, 2011 for approval before submission. These reviews were led by the Treasurer.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Conflict of Interest declaration forms are submitted annually in January by members of the Board of Trustees and are distributed to the full board for information puposes, and reviewed in depth by the Governance Committee. It is the members responsibility to notify the board should any conflicts arise in between signings and of all members of the board to immediately raise any conflicts that they become aware of. Board members with conflicts will recuse themselves from discussions and votes on that issue.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Compensation Committee of the board conducts the CEO evaluation and compensation process. The CEOs performance is reviewed against the targets set for the year and his semi annual bonus determination. The CEOs compensation is compared vs the Sullivan Cotter and Associates information and periodically reviewed by our compensation consultant. No one with a conflict of interest relative to the hospital is involved in these discussions, and minutes are recorded by the Secretary of the Board.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Memorial Hospital will make copies of such documents available to the general public upon request.
